timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -70,6 +83,19 @@ * <property name="allowLineBreaks" value="true"/> * </module> * + *

Example:

+ * 
+ * java .lang .Integer foo = 1;
+ *  // ^     ^ violation, No whitespace before '.' is allowed
+ * java.lang.Integer bar = 1; // OK
+ * int bar
+ * ; // OK, Linebreak is allowed
+ * Object o = new java.lang.Object();
+ * o . toString(); // violation, whitespace before '.' is not allowed
+ * o
+ *     .toString(); // OK, Linebreak is allowed

timeline.bodyText:
please make code formatted like:
c.setFirstName("John")
 .setLastName("Doe")

indentation is 1 spaces, to keep dots aligned (as people usually do with chained calls)
as we do not have that much options in Check, please make two examples blocks have the same code, so user will easily see how behvior changes when allowLineBreaks is activated.
timeline.author: romani
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -70,6 +83,19 @@ * <property name="allowLineBreaks" value="true"/> * </module> * + *

Example:

+ * 
+ * Map .Entry e = null; // violation, whitespace before '.' is not allowed
+ * Map.Entry f = null; // OK
+ * int foo
+ * ; // OK, linebreak is allowed
+ * Customer c = new Customer(); // Customer is a user defined class
+ * c . getCustomer(); // violation, whitespace before '.' is not allowed
+ * c
+ *     .setFirstName("John")
+ *     .setLastName("Doe")

@@ -70,6 +84,17 @@ * <property name="allowLineBreaks" value="true"/> * </module> * + *

Example:

replies.bodyText:
to make it for user to show change in behavior we need to do following

show default config with code
show config with allowLineBreaks enabled only, show how behavior is changing
show config with modified tokens to show that violations could be avoided from previous example by defining target of validation.

you can get inspiration on custom targets at 
  
    
      checkstyle/src/main/resources/google_checks.xml
    
    
         Line 252
      in
      aa5a9fd
    
    
    
    

        
          
           <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore"> 
        
    
  


and at 
  
    
      checkstyle/config/checkstyle_checks.xml
    
    
         Line 709
      in
      646d90e
    
    
    
    

        
          
           <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore"/>
replies.author: romani

replies.bodyText:
the reason of default is ok with chained methods because it does not validate them, DOT is not default token - https://checkstyle.org/config_whitespace.html#NoWhitespaceBefore .
Lets make example 2 with all possible tokens defined, to show show difference in behavior for each token with and wihtout allowLineBreaks. So user will get clear picture of how it works.
replies.author: romani

replies.bodyText:
Sorry for being late there, I had some personal issues, I have pushed the code with three configuration
1. with default configuration
2. with allowLineBreak on default tokens
3. with allowLineBreak on only DOT token

thankyou @romani

timeline.author: romani
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -61,6 +61,48 @@ * 
  * <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore"/>
  *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * int foo;
+ * foo ++; // violation, whitespace before '++' is not allowed
+ * foo++; // OK
+ * for (int i = 0 ; i < 5; i++) {}  // violation
+ *            // ^ whitespace before ';' is not allowed
+ * for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {} // OK
+ * int[][] array = { { 1, 2, 3 }
+ *                 , { 4, 5, 6 }// violation
+ *                 , { 7, 8, 9 } }; // violation, whitespace before ',' is not allowed
+ * int[][] array2 = { { 1, 2, 3 },
+ *                    { 4, 5, 6 },
+ *                    { 7, 8, 9 } }; // OK
+ * Customer c = new Customer(); // Customer is a user-defined class
+ * c.setFirstName("John")
+ *  .setLastName("Doe")
+ *  ; // violation, linebreak is not allowed before ';' token
+ *
+ *

To configure the check to allow linebreaks before default tokens:

+ * 
+ * <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore">
+ *   <property name="allowLineBreaks" value="true"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

Example:

+ * 
+ * int[][] array = { { 1, 2, 3 }
+ *                 , { 4, 5, 6 } // OK
+ *                 , { 7, 8, 9 } }; // OK, linebreak is allowed before default tokens

replies.bodyText:
We do not need example of:
        <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore">
            <property name="tokens" value="DOT"/>
            <property name="allowLineBreaks" value="true"/>
        </module>

we need :
        <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore">           
             <property name="tokens" value="DOT"/> 
             <property name="tokens" value="METHOD_REF"/> 
        </module>

and
        <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore">           
             <property name="tokens" value="DOT"/> 
             <property name="tokens" value="METHOD_REF"/> 
             < property name="allowLineBreaks" value="true"/>
        </module>
replies.author: romani

timeline.bodyText:
to avoid this comment please use chaining method based on jdk classes.
Here are examples on iterating over String https://www.techiedelight.com/iterate-over-characters-string-java/
like:
    "example".chars()
        .mapToObj(i -> Character.valueOf((char) i))
        .forEach(System.out::print);
